ndz_document.ndz_title: On-Axis Field of a Finite, Straight, Thin Shell Solenoid
ndz_document.ndz_abstract: This formula uses the formula for the field due to a current loop, integrated over a range of axial displacements to obtain the magnetic field at any point on the axis of a finite, thin shell solenoid.

ndz_section.title: General Case

ndz_image.name: equation1
ndz_image.alt: Field inside a thin shell solenoid

ndz_section.p: B is the magnetic field, in teslas, at any point on the axis of the solenoid. The direction of the field is parallel to the solenoid axis.
μo is the permeability constant (1.26x10-6 H/m)
i is the current in the wire, in amperes.
N is the total number of turns of wire in the solenoid.
l is the length of the solenoid, in meters.
r is the radius of the solenoid, in meters.

ndz_section.title: Special Case

ndz_image.name: equation2
ndz_image.alt: Field at the center of a thin shell solenoid

ndz_section.p: The magnetic field measurement point is at the center of the solenoid.
